title: Album Page, "Studies of Buildings and Ornament, Freudenstadt", September 13, 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed:
Recto, in graphite, from upper right corner: (inscribed in circle) 42 / 54 / Steeple at / Freundestadt [sic] / Sept 13th 1887 / A little house sticking out of the / (Freudenstadt) Black Forest / Arm to church stall / Freudenstadt.  

Note: inscription about the house in the Black Forest seems to have had "Freudenstadt" added earlier or later so that the inscription should read: A little house sticking out of the / Black Forest
description: Vertical sheet containing three sketches. Above, a detail of a winged, serpent-like creature resting its arms on a slanting support, and its tail curled upward.  According to the artist's inscription, this is an "arm to a church stall".  Below left is a small square building with steeply pitched roof and 'trapgevel' façade nestled in a dense stand of trees.  At lower right, the steeple of a Romanesque masonry tower.  The steeple has two octagonal levels, the uppermost topped by a tall cupola and small square tower with ball finial and weathervane.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Studies of Buildings and Ornament, Freudenstadt", September 13, 1887.
September 13, 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-122.
